questions.text: Who attempted to release the prisoners in the DEO containment facility?
questions.explanation:
Lucy Lane.

	She was under some type of mind control from Non, as the Myriad program had started. The only one of the prisoners she released was Maxima.

questions.text: Why did Maxima decide to swear allegiance to Non?
questions.correct: Superman had declined to marry her.
options: Supergirl had been mean to her when they went to high school together.
Non's wife had been her cousin.
questions.explanation:
Superman had declined to marry her.

	She was the queen of her planet and wanted nothing more than to rule Earth. She was wearing a green outfit and had bright red hair.

questions.text: Why was Superman *not* able to help Supergirl during the early parts of the episode?
questions.correct: He was attending to an affair off of their plane of existence.
options: He had been kidnapped prior to the episode starting.
It wasn't explained, only said he was busy.
He was fighting off a flu caused by Kryptonite.
questions.explanation:
He was attending to an affair off of their plane of existence.

	When Supergirl asked for help locating him him the robot helper in the Fortress of Solitude told her he was off world. Instead Kara got information about Myriad from a computer simulation of her mother.

questions.text: National City was quarantined during the episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Gen. Sam Lane put the city under quarantine due to the effects of Myriad. The only people in the city other than Kara not affected by the alien signal were Cat Grant and Maxwell Lord.

questions.text: How was the Myriad signal being sent across the city?
options: Large speakers were build on top of skyscrapers
questions.explanation:
Broadcast over satellites.

	The Kryptonians had broken into Maxwell Lord's labs and taken control of his satellites months earlier. Lord's suggestion on how to stop them was to kill them all since he couldn't reprogram the satellites.

questions.text: Why wasn't Alex in National City?
questions.correct: She was looking for her father.
options: She was on a top secret mission.
She was reassigned by the military.
questions.explanation:
She was looking for her father.

	She had left the city as a fugitive with Hank Henshaw. They were on their way to the Cadmus labs to look for Jeremiah Danvers. Alex had learned a few episodes earlier that her father was still alive.

questions.text: Superman made an appearance midway through the episode. Why was he ineffective?
questions.correct: He had grown up on Earth, and therefore was affected by Myriad.
options: He was hit with a Kryptonite beam.
He had lost his powers due to an eclipse.
It wasn't explained why he was unable to help, he just collapsed.
questions.explanation:
He had grown up on Earth, and therefore was affected by Myriad.

	Because he had grown up on Earth, his mind worked more like an Earthling, and not like a Kryptonian according to Maxwell Lord. Because Kara hadn't arrived until her teens years she still thought more like an alien than a human.

questions.text: Non made three people jump out of windows to their presumed death. How many did Supergirl save?
questions.explanation:
2.

	She saved James and Winn, but didn't manage to snag Kelly. Kelly was a redhead wearing a red shirt and had not previously been a key piece to the show.

questions.text: After National City, Non had planned to take over which city next?
questions.explanation:
Washington D.C.

	In arguing with Indigo over what to do, he told her he planned to take over Washington. She argued with him that Myriad could let him take over the universe, not just the Earth, but he was too stupid to realize it.

questions.text: Alex was taken over by mind control and used her Kryptonite sword cut off Supergirl's left hand.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Alex was in a Kryptonite powered suit, with her sword at the end of the episode. She was under mind control, but the fight wasn't shown. The two leaped at each other as the episode ended.
